page.description: The .FIND() method finds a value in the query list and returns a pointer to the Key_Value found. The key has two properties: key and record, as illustrated below.

argument.name: Key_Ptr
argument.description: A dot variable that contains an element named "key", which has been set to the search value.

argument.name: Key_Value
argument.description: A search value to compare to entries in the query list.

section.description: In both the following examples, the .FIND() method finds the nearest matching key.
section.example: dim tbl as P dim qry as P tbl = table.open("test") query.filter = "ID <> ''" query.options = "D" qry = tbl.query_create() ? qry.find("11112-01") = Key = "11112-01" Record = 5
